item.title: Hugues Oyarzabal, Surfing Star Who Rode With a Camera, Dies at 39
item.description: With a video recorder affixed to his board or clamped to his teeth, he took viewers along for the ride, often inside the curling “barrel” of a wave.

item.title: ‘Severance’ Season 2 Finale: Mark vs. Mark
item.description: The season ended with a bizarre but moving episode that found the Lumon employees’ inner and outer selves at cross purposes.

item.title: ‘It Sounds Strange, Doesn’t It?’ Trump Muses About Gutting the Education Dept.
item.description: President Trump signed the executive order in the East Room of the White House, which was packed with jittery children.

item.title: How ‘Severance’ Uses Old Tricks to Make Its Office Hell
item.description: Clocks, elevators and cubicles become dystopian signifiers in the television show, which invokes and inverts workplace cinema.

item.title: Israel Tries to Pressure Hamas to Free More Hostages
item.description: Israel’s defense minister said it was preparing to seize more territory in Gaza and intensify attacks unless the Palestinian group freed more of the d...
